subject: Re: Sample code for using JUnit on SOAP-based service-oriented architecture
msgSnippet: Trying to re-post the link to the JUnit for SOA sample code   in a manner
messageBody:
Trying to re-post the link to the JUnit for SOA sample code
<http://http://michael01612.spaces.live.com/blog/cns%212D894EF96C8FC0%21\
2059.entry> in a manner where the link isn't broken.




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mike Foley" <mike_foley_01612@...> wrote:
>
> Thought I'd share some sample code for using JUnit to test SOAP-based
> service-oriented architectures.
>
> http://michael01612.spaces.live.com/blog/cns!2D894EF96C8FC0!2059.entry
>
> Uses Paramterized Test Case Design Pattern (JUnit Recipes, 4.8).
> XMLUnit to do XML-based assertions using XPath. Data-driven in that
> it reads testcases from a filesystem (test case defined as an XML
> request, an XPath, and a value).
>
> Maybe it will help someone else.
>
> Michael Foley
>



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
